intro: Peucedanum flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, slightly bitter scent. Peucedanum flexuosum is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
